website_summaries.verdict: Wooden beard combs have many advantages over metal or plastic versions, and the Striking Viking's sandalwood tines run smoothly through coarse beards.
pros: Natural sandalwood holds and distributes beard oils well
Leaves a pleasant fragrance in beard after grooming
cons: Can grab longer, curlier beard hairs
Some unpleasant odors and discoloration reported
Minimal difference between coarse and fine sides

customer_reviews.title: The best among like products
customer_reviews.text: I also got the beard comb from the rocky mountain barber company, and I had that one first and for a couple of weeks before I received this one. By far this is better for the sole reason that it's soft on your skin. The two are pretty much identical, but when you're combing your beard the teeth from other one will irritate your skin if you comb it too many times. Since I'm growing a beard out after having a short one for a while, training my beard and combing with or without oil I have to comb it frequently to get it going in the right direction. This one is now the only one I use.

My only wish is that the comb teeth have slightly sharper points. The teeth are so rounded I sometimes feel like the comb is pushing my beard hair too much whereas it could be piercing into it more. However, it is comfortable and effective.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Rovny

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 PERFECT

customer_reviews.title: Really enjoy this comb.  Great for beards!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great comb! I really have always feared combing out my beard, as most of my experiences have been painful. While gearing up for Movember, I figured I'd see what new products were out there as growing a beard has become more trendy. One post discussed Wood combs as a great alternative. I took the plunge and, being a Viking myself I chose this one. I haven't been disappointed. I greatly enjoy using this comb and would recommend it to anyone growing a beard, or looking for a great comb for their hair.

Good job guys and on another note when and if my wife ever grows a beard I will buy her one as well.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend it!!!
customer_reviews.text: So my beard is at about 3", give or take, and I've always kept a little 2 inch comb in my wallet and though i love it, its teeth arent quite long enough .. but i didn't want to go bigger because of bulkiness in my pocket, but this striking viking is perfect.. long teeth for a good thorough comb, thin and feels comfortable in the hand, and the case is thin but strong enough to protect the teeth .. in summary, I love it.
